column1: Buy Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) Stock on This Q4 Earnings Dip;2/2/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsA few years ago
column4: analysts had to add numbers from dozens of retail companies to see how Christmas went. Now they just wait on the earnings fromAmazon.com
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column6: which came out after the market closed on Feb. 2. Unfortunately
column7: Christmas wasn't as rosy as hoped
column8: and AMZN stock is down about 4% in Thursday's after-market trade as a result.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockAmazon's final numbers were somewhat mixed. AMZN beat estimates on the earnings front
column9: bringing in $1.54 per share - better than the consensus mark of $1.40
column10: and the company's seventh straight quarter of profit.But Amazon was light on revenues
column11: at $43.74 billion versus expectations of $44.84 billion. That still was a big jump from the $35.75 billion in revs last year
column12: but not enough to please investors or experts. That caused AMZN stock to drop 4% within minutes.Bad news for most
column13: though some - includingBlue Chip Growtheditor Louis Navellier - were hoping to buy Amazon stock on the dip.CEO Jeff Bezos emphasized the variety of Amazon Prime servicesin his release
column14: mentioning new offerings in gaming
column15: storage
column16: music and its Prime Now same-day shopping services. The company's studio launched hit shows likeThe Grand TourandMan in the High Castle
column17: while the movieManchester by the Seadrew Oscar nominations but will debut on Prime within a few months.5 Stocks to Buy to Defy a Weak FebruaryOur James Brumley was expecting fireworks after earnings
column18: but most options traders were not making big bets either way. Most recently
column19: I took some money off the table on Amazon
column20: which as I noted was becoming a huge piece of my retirement savings.The biggest news from the analyst community was a super-bull call from Bill Miller
column21: chairman of LMM Investments
column22: claiming the value of AMZN stockcould double again in three years- making it more valuable thanApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL). He also stating that Amazon now has higher gross margins thanWal-Mart Stores Inc.(NYSE:WMT)
column23: which regularly sells nearly $120 billion of merchandise each quarter - not just at Christmas.The big turn in Amazon stock started when the company started breaking out numbers from Amazon Web Services
column24: its cloud services unit
column25: after the first quarter of 2015. Since then
column26: the company has more than doubled
column27: as the unit has been growing at 50% per year and proving it can book one-fourth of that revenue as operating profit
column28: even when accounting for stock options given its top employees.In the third quarter
column29: for instance
column30: AWS earned $861 million on revenues of $3.231 billion. Yes
column31: that's more thanthe whole company earned. Amazon still loses money regularly on its international expansion
column32: where it now brings in nearly one-third of its revenue. For the fourth quarter
column33: AWS brought in revenue of $3.54 billion
column34: which was seen as disappointing.Why Buy AMZN Stock Now?It's the expectation of huge growth on a massive scale that have made Amazon the fourth-largest company by market capitalization in the U.S. It recently passedBerkshire Hathaway Inc.(NYSE:BRK.B)
column35: whose revenues regularly run 50% better than Amazon's Christmas expectations.Shares dropped 5.1% the day after the third quarter missed expectations oOct. 27
column36: and you could have gotten Amazon for $719 per share two weeks later
column37: on Nov. 14. But since then the stock has been on fire
column38: and closed before earnings near $840 per share.Alibaba Group Holding Ltd (BABA) Stock Has a Secret WeaponBuyers keep coming for Amazon because every quarter
column39: it seems to do something spectacular.This quarter
column40: for instance
column41: it delivered a new credit card offering 5% all Amazon purchases to Prime members. It announced a new air hub near Cincinnati
column42: sinking sharesofUnited Parcel Service
column43: Inc.(NYSE:UPS) andFedEx Corporation(NYSE:FDX). Its Alexa personal assistant dominated the Consumer Electronics Show
column44: as our Brad Moon reported.All this has made AMZN stock a must-have for a growing number of small investors
column45: who race in whenever the stock stumbles.Just like it did this afternoon.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column46: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing
column47: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryThe 5 Best Stocks to Buy for Big Emerging Markets Profits7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 2018The postBuy Amazon.com
column48: Inc. (AMZN) Stock on This Q4 Earnings Dipappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Amazon Earnings: AMZN EPS Climbs 54 Percent
column2: Beats by 19 Cents;2/2/2017;"Amazon earnings (Shutterstock photo)Retail giant Amazon.com (AMZN) reported fourth quarter fiscal 2016 earnings result after the market closed Thursday that showed the extent to which CEO Jeff Bezos can mash the profit accelerator whenever he wants. Though critics often complain about Amazon’s razor blade business model or the company’s aggressive spending
column3: the stock has made investors rich over the past five years.With the success comes high expectations. Despite the strong 19-cent beat
column4: Amazon shares are down some 3.5%. Investors who have waited for a solid buying opportunity now have their chance. Aside from the strong beat on the bottom line
column5: Amazon not only offered solid fiscal 2017 guidance
column6: the company’s dominant AWS cloud service showed enough growth momentum
column7: suggesting higher profits in the quarters ahead. The smart thing to to now? Buy the stock and thank me in December.makeArticleAd();Let’s go through the numbers.For the three months that ended December
column8: the Seattle-based e-commerce giant reported net income of $749 million
column9: or $1.54 per share
column10: compared with $482 million
column11: or $1 per share
column12: in the year-earlier period. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters expected the Amazon to earn $1.36 per share. Fourth quarter revenue grew 22% year over year $43.7 billion from $35.7 billion a year ago
column13: but missed consensus estimate of $44.7 billion. Amazon in December reported its strongest-ever holiday sales.Revenue from Amazon Web Services
column14: the company's cloud services business
column15: surged 47% year over year to $3.54 billion. The company also benefited from a 22% rise in North America revenue
column16: reaching $26.2 billion and a 18% increase in international revenue of $13.9 billion.“Our Prime team’s customer obsession kept them busy in 2016
column17: ” said CEO Jeff Bezos in a statement. “Prime members can now choose from over 50 million items with free two-day shipping — up 73% since 2015. Prime Video is now available in more than 200 countries and territories. Prime Now added 18 new cities
column18: which means millions more members now get one and two hour delivery.”The company announced it will create more than 100
column19: 000 new full-time
column20: full-benefit jobs in the U.S. over the next 18 months. It said these jobs will include positions across the country for all types of experience
column21: education
column22: and skill levels. In terms of guidance
column23: Amazon expects first quarter revenue to be in the range of $33.25 billion and $35.75 billion
column24: which assumed growth of 14% to 23% year over year. This compares to analysts estimates for revenue of $36 billion.Amazon stock closed during Thursday regular session at $840.18
column25: up 0.94%. The stock has risen 12% year to date
column26: besting the 2% rise in the S&P 500 Index. With shares falling on what was actually solid results
column27: I expect Amazon stock to bounce back
column28: reaching $1
column29: 000 per share
column30: delivering 22% returns in the next 12 to 18 months."

column1: Warning: Don’t Sell Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Short!;2/2/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA)
column3: whose shares spiked 224% in 2016
column4: has been lethal for short sellers. They lost a stunning$4.4 billion. And yes
column5: it will probably still be bad for them to continue with their bearish bets on NVDA stock for the new year.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockNow short sellers are some of the world's best investors. If anything
column6: they have to since the consequences of being wrong are so great! After all
column7: a win for a short seller is if the stock goes to zero - which rarely happens. But as seen with Nvidia shares
column8: the downside can be horrific.The irony is that short positions can provide tremendous fuel for price appreciation. Keep in mind that short sellers need to buy back shares to close out their positions.Something else to keep in mind: It's generally not a good strategy to take a short position merely because the valuation is excessive. There are many examples of companies - likeMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) in the 1980s and 1990s
column9: orAmazon.com
column10: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) during the past decade - that have sustained long bull runs. Wall Street is more than willing to place premiums on firms that can grow fast and with consistency.As for NVDA stock
column11: the valuation is definitely pricey. Consider that the forward price-earnings ratio is roughly at 42! By comparison
column12: Intel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) trades at 12.5 andQualcomm
column13: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) sports a multiple of 11.10 Stocks to Buy That Already Make America GreatBut
column14: of course
column15: NVDA is growing at breakneck speed. So over time the multiples will normalize as the earnings continue to build up. For example
column16: in the latest quarter
column17: Nvidia reporteda sizzling 54% spike in revenuesto $2 billion and GAAP earnings came to 83 cents a share
column18: up 89%.The thing to keep in mind is that Nvidia is positioned nicely to benefit from various megatrends
column19: which should provide lots of room for growth. The company's deep experience with graphics processing units (GPUs)
column20: which allow for intensive computations
column21: is becoming the elixir for cloud computing
column22: artificial intelligence
column23: virtual reality
column24: self-driving cars and gaming. All these markets are massive and on the verge of major changes.For example
column25: according to a recentpresentationfrom Nvidia
column26: the market opportunity for autos alone is at least $10 billion. And the company may be in the best position to benefit. The company has built a full platform for so-called AI car computing - called Nvidia Drive PX 2 - that uses high-performance chips and software to detect surroundings as well as determine optimal routes. Actually
column27: there are over80 automakers that use the system
column28: includingTesla Motors Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA).At the core of all of Nvidia's advantages in various large markets is the company's focus on AI. For the most part
column29: GPUs have proven adept at this type of advanced computing
column30: which allow for trillions of deep learning transactions per second. The result is that a system can quickly adapt and learn. So
column31: this means a self-driving car will know where to turn or stop. Or it could mean that a corporate cloud system has the ability to understand important trends or risks.According toInvestorPlace'sBrad Moon:""Because the GPU is designed for one primary purpose - everything including computer graphics boils down to crunching numbers - NVDA is able to produce them at far lower cost than a CPU at an equivalent performance level
column32: while producing less heat and using less power.""Great
column33: right? Definitely.Valeant Pharmaceuticals Intl Inc (VRX) Has Only a Little Time LeftYet
column34: this does not necessarily mean that the NVDA stock price will continue to rack up three-digit returns for years to come. No doubt
column35: there will be lots of volatility. But again
column36: when a company is at the forefront of tidal changes in technologies

column1: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd (BABA) Stock Has a Secret Weapon;2/2/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAlibaba Group Holding Ltd(NYSE:BABA) is often compared toAmazon.com
column3: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column4: which isn't always accurate. Most notably
column5: Alibaba doesn't hold inventory like its larger U.S. peer
column6: and it doesn't have AMZN's massive distribution capabilities. But
column7: there is one notable similarity that doesn't seem priced into BABA stock at the moment:makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockA large
column8: fast-growing cloud computing offering.Amazon's cloud business
column9: called Amazon Web Services (AWS)
column10: has been a major factor in the rise of AMZN stock from less than $200 to more than $800 over the past five years.Alibaba Cloud is still much smaller
column11: but its growth profile looks much like that of AWS back in 2011-12. That explosive growth - and the ability to be a legitimate competitor to Amazon.com andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) - has the potential to drive significant additional upside in BABA stock.The Impact of Alibaba Cloud on BABA StockSo far
column12: the cloud business hasn't done much for Alibaba's revenue
column13: or BABA stock
column14: for that matter. BABA still trades around $100
column15: basically the same levels at which it went public in late 2014.Through the first nine months of fiscal 2016
column16: cloud has generated just 3.3% of total revenue. Over the past four quarters
column17: Alibaba's cloud sales total just $765 million - likely less than 6% of what AWS will create in calendar 2016. And at the moment
column18: Alibaba's cloud business actually is a drag on BABA earnings. The business has lost $92 million in EBITA (not EBITDA; BABA uses EBITA for segment income) over the past four quarters.3 BRICS Buys That Play Banking
column19: Buying and ... Beef?But the gap to Amazon and the losses in the business have more to do with Alibaba's relatively late start than with a lack of demand. Cloud revenue growth has been impressive
column20: increasing 130% through the first nine months of fiscal 2016
column21: and 115% in the December quarter
column22: despite a pricing cut.That follows a 138% increase in cloud sales in fiscal 2016. Most impressively
column23: the number of customers nearly doubled year-over-year in Q3
column24: and BABA added 114
column25: 000 new customers in the December quarter alone.As for profitability
column26: Alibaba isn't worried
column27: yet
column28: with management saying on the Q3 conference call it was spending to gain market share. Profitability will come
column29: but for now
column30: Alibaba is looking to cement its dominance of the lucrative Chinese market.Losses now are OK - AWS lost money until recently - because those new customers will provide high-margin recurring revenue going forward
column31: possibly for decades.The Impact of Alibaba Cloud on BABA Stock Going ForwardThe good news for BABA stock is that it looks like the cloud business is nearing an inflection point. Losses are narrowing
column32: but still represent a drag on overall earnings for BABA. Over the past 12 months
column33: cloud has actually had a negative impact on EPS of about $0.03. That will change shortly
column34: as Alibaba has said that the business will hit a profit around 1 million users
column35: a milestone almost certain to be hit in 2017.The question is what happens after that. If Alibaba's growth looks anything like Amazon's going forward
column36: it should be very positive for BABA stock.AMZN didn't break out cloud revenue until 2015; it appears that the business generated about $1 billion in sales in 2011 and $2 billion in 2012. That then grew to almost $4 billion in 2013
column37: $5.6 billion in 2014
column38: and $7.9 billion in 2015. 2016 growth to date suggests a figure over $12 billion in 2016. AWS is now estimated by analysts to be worth (on its own) about $150-$160 billion.Can Alibaba grow its cloud business to the same extent? Goldman Sachs analysts argued it could
column39: projecting a valuefor Alibaba Cloud of $42 billion by 2019
column40: based on $5 billion in sales. That growth alone would add almost 20% to the value of BABA stock over the next few years and it's not as outlandish as it seems.The Future Looks Bright for BABA StockGrowth rates have been over 100%
column41: yet cloud computing is still relatively unknown in China. On the Q3 conference call
column42: Alibaba CEO Daniel Zhang estimated that
column43: even assuming pricing discounts to lure customers using hard drives
column44: the addressable market for cloud in China would be $30 billion. And in November
column45: Alibaba added new data centers in four locations worldwide: Sydney
column46: Tokyo
column47: Dubai and Germany.The concern might be whether a Chinese company will be able to compete internationally with Amazon and Microsoft. U.S. companies might prefer domestic providers
column48: and elsewhere there could be worries about security.But
column49: the reverse of that argument is that Alibaba should have a huge advantage in marketing to Chinese consumers
column50: as those customers might be similarly unwilling to use American companies for their cloud services. Even with BABA now worth approximately $250 billion
column51: the $30 billion Chinese market is more than enough to provide a material catalyst.3 Stocks to Buy for Better Deals Than the Great RecessionAWS profit margins already arenearing 25%despite its own spending in that business. Assuming Alibaba can get half of the Chinese market at 30% margins
column52: the cloud segment could contribute as much as $1.50 per share in EPS annually
column53: enough to add $30 billion-$40 billion in market value. Any international success would simply add to that value.Until now
column54: the business hasn't been a focus of BABA stock investors
column55: but that seems likely to change. When the company hits the 1 million mark and turns cloud profitable in 2017
column56: coverage of the business should likely increase. And
column57: further awareness of that driver seems equally likely to drive upside for BABA stock. Investors should consider getting long in Alibaba stock before the rest of the market figures that out.As of this writing
column58: Vince Martin did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 5 Best Stocks to Buy for Big Emerging Markets ProfitsThe Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruarySears Holdings Corp (SHLD): A Great American Tragedy Nears Its EndThe postAlibaba Group Holding Ltd (BABA) Stock Has a Secret Weaponappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 3 BRICS Buys That Play Banking
column2: Buying and … Beef?;2/2/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsEmerging markets like the BRICS countries - Brazil
column4: Russia
column5: India
column6: China and South Africa - haven't exactly been an investing friend in recent years. Before the Great Recession
column7: EMs were one of the best places to find a hefty dose of capital gains. As these nations grew and expanded
column8: so did their stocks. Broad-based funds like theiShares MSCI Emerging Markets ETF(NYSE:EEM) weretheplace to find great long-term gains.makeArticleAd();Source:Rodrigo Soldon Via FlickrThen the bottom dropped out.Emerging markets stocks spent the last few years just scraping by. Some analysts question whether you need them anymore for growth - especially some of the more developed BRICS countries.But a funny thing happened. Emerging markets have come back and have posted their beststart to a year since 2012. The primary driver has been the reflation trade in the United States - given many of these nation's ties to commodities
column9: developing markets have often done very well in periods of inflation.Add that to other positives - young workforces
column10: massive consumer potential and rising GDPs - emerging markets (even the BRICS) are once again the place to be.The 5 Best Stocks to Buy for Big Emerging Markets ProfitsToday
column11: we'll look at three BRICS stocks to buy today.BRICS Stocks to Buy: BRF SA (BRFS)When you think beef
column12: odds are you think Texas. But instead of the Lone Star state
column13: you should be thinking about … Brazil.Brazil is the world's largest exporter of beef and poultry. AndBRF SA (ADR)(NYSE:BRFS) just happens to take the crown when it comes to that exporting. The former Brasil Foods ships its meat to more than 150 different countries - both emerging and developed - around the world.BRF SA is a (pardon the pun) prime example of how country of origin can be meaningless. The bulk of BRFS' revenues are generated outside of Brazil's borders.Its dominant position as the world's largest exporter of chicken and beef is reason alone to consider the stock. However
column14: the firm has expanded heavily in prepackage foods in recent years. These higher-margin goods have allowed BRF SA to overcome some of the weakness in the global poultry market.The company also is the biggest producer of halal meat in the world - a growing demand
column15: and higher margins help here too.All told
column16: BRF SA has great financials including low debt leverage and healthy cash positions. Still
column17: BRFS is treated like a castaway
column18: paying just 6 times forward earnings despite a nearly 3% dividend yield to boot.BRICS Stocks to Buy: HDFC Bank (HDB)India has a population of 1.25 billion (at least as of 2013)
column19: and it's one of the best emerging markets to own for rising consumerism.While that means a boon for consumer stocks
column20: it also means big things for financial services. India features one of thelargest un- and underbanked populations in the entire world. AndHDFC Bank Limited (ADR)(NYSE:HDB) happens to be the superstar of this banking-starved BRICS market.HDB is India's second largest private lender. That position has suited it well over the years as it has managed to produce a staggering 29% annual average growth over nearly two decades. And while performing loans helped
column21: the real story is reaching out and getting more customers.As corporate lending has stalled
column22: HBFC has plowed heavily into personal and retail banking and lending. Even better: HBFC is theleading credit card issuer in India. While net interest margins aren't as large down on the retail side
column23: there is tremendous volume and potential to pick up more down the road. New initiatives such as mobile and text message banking are designed to add these underbanked customers to its mix.5 Stocks to Buy to Defy a Weak FebruaryThe opportunity for financial services across numerous emerging markets is huge. HBFC is one of the best BRICS stocks to buy to play the trend.BRICS Stocks to Buy: Alibaba (BABA)China is the king of emerging markets. While its growth isn't as breakneck as it used to be
column24: and while other EMs are growing more quickly
column25: China still has enormous potential not just because of its own populace
column26: but the potential for international expansion by its larger firms.Thus
column27: if you were to buy and hold just one Chinese stock
column28: it would have to beAlibaba Group Holdings Ltd(NYSE:BABA).Heck
column29: it might even be the best tech stock acrossallmarkets.InvestorPlace'sJeff Reevespoints out at MarketWatchthat:""China's internet population just surpassed 730 million after a roughly 6% growth rate last year. That number is more than the entire population of the U.S.
column30: Russia
column31: Japan and Germany combined.""What's more: This number still is growing. We're only about halfway regarding China's total population.As the nation's leading e-commerce site
column32: BABA is at the forefront to profit from the digital revolution in China. Perhaps more importantly
column33: it does so very profitably. See
column34: Alibaba is unlike rivalAmazon.com
column35: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) in that it doesn't sell products from its own warehouses and holds the inventory. Alibaba only acts as a middleman for other retailers. That means higher margins per transaction.And as BABA continues to expand into non-core
column36: but still significant opportunities - cloud computing
column37: logistics
column38: financial services - its fortunes should grow as well.Alibaba stock trades at 23 times forward earnings
column39: so it's hardly cheap. But this BRICS stock represents perhaps the world's best e-commerce firm in the world's largest emerging market. That premium is worth it.As of this writing
column40: Aaron Levitt did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.The post3 BRICS Buys That Play Banking
column41: Buying and … Beef?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column2: Amazon.com
column3: Inc. (AMZN) and Cincinnati Financial Corporation (CINF);2/2/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsWe're still seeing a lot of weakness in the market as the earnings season is failing to add the spark that most investors were hoping for. While the aggregate bullish effect of the season hasn't been felt
column5: there have been some stocks that are seeing opportunities to extend themselves higher likeMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) andAmazon.com
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN). On the other hand
column7: Cincinnati Financial Corporation(NASDAQ:CINF) has found itself in a must-win situation ahead of next week's earnings results as the company's stock is barely hanging on to its long-term bullish trend.makeArticleAd();Amazon.com
column8: Inc. (AMZN)Amazon heads into the earnings confessional this afternoon as the stock sits near its highs around $850 technically teasing those looking at taking a position ahead of the numbers.The charts indicate that AMZN shares have become less overbought over the last week as the stock took a move towards its 20-day moving average. This move is very familiar to those of us that watch Amazon as it is a carbon copy of the pre-earnings activity last quarter.Today's AMZN chart is somewhat different and more supportive of the bulls as the stock is now shifting into an intermediate-term bull trend with the 50-day trendline crossing back over the 100-day. Our historical testing shows that Amazon stock is 63% more likely to outperform the at-any-time returns for the two months following this crossover.Volume on AMZN has dropped a little over the last week as we've seen traders back away ahead of the earnings. Call options on the stock have dropped in premium
column9: suggesting that the options traders aren't expecting Amazon stock to knock the cover off of the ball this afternoon.7 High-Yield Stocks Ripe For A Short SqueezeThis adds up to breakout potential for the stock on an in-line report. The potential fly in the ointment would be the fact that MSFT is growing their Azure line of business. Watch for this to take a little away from the magic that has been AWS
column10: Amazon's real driving force. Outside of that
column11: the charts suggest a breakout on the way for AMZN.Cincinnati Financial Corporation (CINF)Last month
column12: Cincinnati Financial shares took a hit on the exposure to the tragedy in Gatlinburg. Since then
column13: CINF shares have spent their time consolidating and trying to place a tradable bottom
column14: but there's a hanging issue.As of this week
column15: all but the 200-day moving average have transitioned into a short- to intermediate-term bearish pattern. This means that Cincinnati Financial stock is likely to start feeling more pressure from the sellers again as overhead pressure builds.CINF chart watchers remember the significance of the $70-level last October. The shares took a decline to this level after an earnings report that failed to impress. Now
column16: Cincinnati Financial prepares to report its quarterly results next Wednesday as the stock sits on this same critical chart support level. This makes the earnings announcement a ""must win"" for CINF.The 20-month moving average sits at $66.50
column17: which is the line in the sand that long-term investors should be watching. A move to or below this level is going to spark additional selling as this stock has been one of the better performers in its peer group.Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)Again we get to cover Microsoft this week as the stock appears to be giving those patient traders an opportunity.Why Amazon.com
column18: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Should Expect Fireworks SoonMSFT shares rallied after a positive earnings announcement and took the shares to new all-time highs. After ringing that bell
column19: the profiteers stepped in to lock in gains resulting in a near 5% drop in the Microsoft stock price.Technically
column20: MSFT stock is now setting up for a nice short-term buying opportunity as it has worked off a technically overbought indication at the same time that it is nearing the 50-day moving average at $62.40.Since breaking above the 50-day in October
column21: Microsoft stock has found significant buying interest on each test of the widely watched trendline. The last test
column22: in December
column23: resulted in an 8% rally over an 11-trading day period.Those looking to hold off and be patient can look for MSFT stock to head to the $60.50
column24: which is the next site of trendline support at the 100-day. For now
column25: our money is on a more shallow pullback to the 50-day holding as the more likely technical scenario to play out on Microsoft.As of this writing

column1: Neilsen Completes Gracenote Buyout
column2: Boosts Watch Segment;2/2/2017;"Nielsen Holdings plcNLSNhas recently completed the acquisition of Gracenote from Tribune Media CompanyTRCOfor $560 million in cash.Gracenote was first acquired by Sony in 2008 and then by Tribune in 2014. The company has big names such as AppleAAPL
column3: Spotify
column4: AmazonAMZN
column5: Tesla BMW
column6: Toyota
column7: Ford and Time Warner Cable on its list of customers. It is the only global company providing data in the four largest and popular entertainment categories - TV show
column8: song
column9: movie and sports.Post acquisition
column10: Gracenote will become part of Nielsen's Watch segment and continue to operate from its Emeryville headquarters. It will be referred as Gracenote
column11: a Nielsen company.Over the last one year
column12: shares of Nielsen have underperformed the Zacks characterizedBusiness Information Servicesindustry. The stock has registered a loss of 12.48% compared with the industry's gain of 14.29%.Benefits of the DealCalifornia-based Gracenote is a leading provider of media and entertainment metadata. The company provides reference information for more than 12 million movie and television listings and 200 million music tracks. Its connected technology is used in over 75 million cars.The deal is a step on Nielsen's part to adopt the latest methodologies to keep pace with shifting media habits. We believe that by leveraging Gracenote's global content database
column13: Neilsen will be able to develop more expansive and detailed tracking methods.Financial ImpactsNeilsen expects the acquisition to be neutral to 2017 GAAP earnings per share and slightly accretive in 2018.The impact of Gracenote was not included in Nielsen's 2017 outlook issued on Dec 8
column14: 2016.  More details on the expected impact of Gracenote will be reported with Nielsen's fourth-quarter results on Feb 9.Our TakeNielsen has been supplementing organizational growth with strategic acquisitions. The company has spent millions on acquisitions to enable broader measurement of consumer media as well as buying behavior of consumers. In March 2016
column15: the company completed its acquisition of eXelate
column16: a provider of data and technology
column17: enabling clients to make better and faster marketing and media decisions.In 2013 end
column18: Nielsen closed the purchase of Arbitron
column19: an international media and marketing research firm
column20: for approximately $1.3 billion in cash. The acquisition enabled Nielsen to introduce audio measurement capabilities in new markets.In 2011
column21: the company acquired NeuroFocus
column22: a leader in developing neuroscience to better understand how consumers engage with advertising
column23: messaging
column24: packaging
column25: product development and entertainment content.Nielsen is leaving no stone unturned to provide clients with greater insight and understanding of the factors that drive consumer behavior across media platforms and retail channels.Nielsen N.V. column1: Google Earnings: The Market Has Made The Same Mistake Twice;2/2/2017;"Google Earnings (Shutterstock photo)As a general rule
column2: the market is pretty good about learning from its mistakes. After all
column3: there is nothing like a hefty loss to teach traders what not to do.That is a simple fact that must be borne in mind when looking for patterns in pricing; if the pattern involves a reaction to news that was ultimately proven wrong
column4: it is unlikely to repeat very often
column5: and the few opportunities when it does should be grabbed with both hands.makeArticleAd();That is what makes Google parent company Alphabet (GOOG:GOOGL) look like such a good buy after its reaction to Q4 earnings.As you can see from the chart below
column6: prior to last week’s earnings report Google (I’m sorry but I just can’t bring myself to call the company “Alphabet”) had dropped sharply on earnings misses contained in two of the previous three releases
column7: in April and October.On both of those occasions
column8: though
column9: the big drop in price was
column10: with the benefit of 20/20 hindsight
column11: an opportunity to buy the stock at a discount. There are different circumstances this time around
column12: of course
column13: but the dynamic that has made negative reactions to earnings in the past opportunities is still in place
column14: so the end result is likely to be the same.The biggest problems with the Q4 results as far as traders were concerned
column15: it seems
column16: were that cost per click was down
column17: and operating costs had risen to the point where earnings per Class A share (EPS) of $9.36 fell short of the Street’s estimates of around $9.64. Still
column18: revenues of $26.06 billion beat the estimated $25.26 billion.There was also a concern lurking in the background regarding Google taking on both Amazon (AMZN)’s Echo and Apple (AAPL)’s iPhone with recent hardware launches. Google said that they were pleased with the reaction to both Google Home and the Pixel phone without going into specifics
column19: but doubts about the wisdom of the strategy persist.I actually believe that Google has a chance of limited success in each case. The Pixel will be the most uphill struggle as the iPhone’s dominance of the mobile phone market is well established. Most estimates of sales of the phone so far are around 1 million
column20: which hardly puts a dent in the iPhone
column21: but may prove to be enough of a base to make the Pixel profitable as a niche product.Home has an easier
column22: more logical path to success as Google is the natural choice of those looking for what is
column23: essentially
column24: a free-standing search engine.Ultimately
column25: though
column26: neither Home nor Pixel is going to be the driver of the recovery in the stock price that history suggests will come soon.First
column27: the increase in operating costs that Google reported seems
column28: on a breakdown of the numbers
column29: to be the result of investment in the core business. Losses in what the company calls “Other Bets
column30: ” things like “Nest” and self driving cars
column31: were actually reduced somewhat in the fourth quarter

column1: Why Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Will NEVER Be About P/E;2/2/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsOne of the biggest negatives surroundingAmazon.com
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) is the company's sky-high price-to-earnings ratio. According to Google Finance
column5: AMZN stock currently trades at an eye-popping 191 times its trailing earnings of $4.36 per share.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut Amazon has at least given investors the courtesy of growing profits to try to somewhat justify the lofty valuation. That 191x is on trailing 12-month earnings of $4.36 per share. In fiscal 2015
column6: AMZN earned $596 million
column7: or $1.25 per share. In 2014
column8: it lost $241 million
column9: which translates into 52 cents per share.It's obvious Amazon stock investors care about growth
column10: not valuation. AMZN's sky-high P/E has been in place for years
column11: and will likely continue for some time.And that's actually OK. Here are two important reasons why:Amazon Revenue GrowthAmazon is still one of the best growth stories in today's market.When the company releases 2016's final numbers Thursday
column12: Feb. 2
column13: analysts expect Amazon to post revenue of $137 billion. That's an improvement of more than 25% versus 2015's top line - a difficult feat when you're talking about 12-digit sales. And Amazon's $107 billion in revenue last year was 20% better than 2014.5 Stocks to Buy to Defy a Weak FebruaryWe live in a world in whichS&P 500constituents are doing well if they're posting just single-digit increases on the top line. You can blame this at least partly on the strong U.S. dollar
column14: which is weighing down American multinationals. But the fact remains that meaningful growth is a scarce quality in today's stock market - especially among blue-chip stocks.Thus
column15: AMZN stock is an easy way for investors to get access to big growth with relatively little risk.And Amazon is hardly running out of fuel. The company has only begun to expand into grocery and apparel - two huge categories. Trillions of dollars are spent worldwide each year at physical stores. That's not to mention the other gains Amazon still could make via the smart home
column16: Amazon Web Services cloud offerings and other newer initiatives.Analysts predict Amazon's revenue will increase another 22% in 2017
column17: hitting $168 billion. So again - the growth story is still well intact.But it's not all about growth. Many AMZN stock bulls argue that we're just looking at earnings the wrong way.Amazon Earnings: Better Than They Seem?One thing that separates Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos from many other executives is his ability to look at the really
column18: reallylong-term. He's also willing to spend billions of dollars on ideas
column19: and is OK with hitting a few duds if it means spawning great new ideas.Remember the company's smartphone? The Amazon Music Importer? How about a website called Askville? I'm guessing you might remember the Fire smartphone
column20: but not the other two. Amazon lost $170 million on its smartphone alone.This kind of risk taking is an inherent part of Amazon's culture. It's the line of thinking that prodded the company to introduce some of its biggest winners to date
column21: like cloud services
column22: Prime shipping and the Kindle.Thus
column23: many investors look at AMZN stock in a different way. They look at the company's operating profit
column24: then they add back its substantial research and development costs to get a ""truer"" sense of profitability.Admittedly
column25: that changes the picture dramatically.Apple Inc. Bulls: Beware These Charts! (AAPL)In its most recent quarter
column26: Amazon produced net income of $252 million
column27: which across 485 million diluted shares became diluted earnings of 52 cents per share. At the time
column28: AMZN was trading at $822 per share. If we annualize that profit (not a perfect measure
column29: as quarterly earnings fluctuate - this is just for an example)
column30: we're looking at a P/E of 395.But Amazon also reported operating profits of $575 million
column31: and spent $4.14 billion on R&D - a significant expense. Add those together
column32: and you get $4.715 billion
column33: or $9.72 per share. Annualize that
column34: then divide the share price by that
column35: and you get a P/E of about 21.Let's take the actual numbers. Amazon currently trades for 190 times trailing 12-month earnings
column36: as we said above. However
column37: over the past four quarters
column38: Amazon spent $15.11 billion on R&D and posted operating profits of more than $4 billion. That comes to $40.19 per share combined
column39: and puts AMZN stock at a P/E of just more than 20.That's a lot of creative accounting
column40: so take that with a spoonful of salt. But it's an interesting argument.Bottom Line on AMZN StockAmazon continues to be one of the best growth stories in today's market. As long as that continues
column41: investors aren't going to care about the headline P/E ratio. It just doesn't matter. AMZN stock has doubled several times over despite it.Amazon is solidly profitable
column42: even if the bottom line isn't as large as investors typically would like. But those earnings are being reinvested back in the business - which is what a high-growth company like Amazon should be doing anyway.As of this writing
column43: Nelson Smith did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceWhy Amazon.com

Read on to see whyAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) andShopify(NYSE: SHOP) stand to benefit from this megatrend perhaps more   than any other companies.Image source: The Motley Fool.makeArticleAd();The titanNo discussion of online retail can take place without   mentioning the mighty Amazon.com. The company dominates   e-commerce -- and
column7: increasingly -- retail as a whole.Amazon's awe inspiring rise has come at the expense of many   traditional brick and mortar retailers
column8: as the online juggernaut   has left retail carnage in its wake. In fact
column9: with Amazon's stock   up more than 20 times in value over the past decade -- and many   of its major rivalsdown sharplyduring that time -- Amazon was worth more than eight of the   largest retailers combined by the end of 2016.The Extraordinary Size of Amazon in One Chart:https://t.co/c5dj1s8aa6$AMZNpic.twitter.com/u9FCK3YXh3- Visual Capitalist (@VisualCap)December 30
column10: 2016With its unmatched value proposition -- built on low prices
column11: a wide selection of goods
column12: inexpensive shipping
column13: and excellent     customer service -- Amazon should only continue to gobble up     retail market share in the years ahead. As such
column14: investors who     buy shares today should be well rewarded
column15: just as those who've     invested in Amazon at any time in its history -- and held their     shares -- have been rewarded to date.Image source: Shopify.The challengerOne of the rare companies that's been able to withstand   Amazon's onslaught is multi-channel commerce platform
column16: Shopify.   In fact
column17: after originally competing with Shopify
column18: Amazon decided   to close down its Webstore service and recommended that its   merchants migrate to Shopify's platform. Since that time
column19: Shopify   has grown at a torrid pace
column20: with the number of merchants using   its platform rising to more than 325
column21: 000 in the third quarter
column22: up   from 200
column23: 000 in the prior year period.Co-founder and CEO Tobi Lutke has positioned the company as an   invaluable provider of cloud-based commerce solutions to small-   and medium-sized businesses
column24: along with a growing number of   larger enterprises such asTesla MotorsandProcter & Gamble. Shopify helps users sell their goods across multiple channels
column25: including online retail marketplaces such as Amazon.com andeBay
column26: social media giants such asFacebookand Pinterest
column27: and standalone websites and brick-and-mortar   stores. In addition
column28: Shopify provides crucial back-office   services such as sales tracking
column29: payment processing
column30: and   inventory management. It's a comprehensive commerce platform   that
column31: along with a growing list of integrated third-party apps
column32: provides users pretty much everything they need to run their   business.""Shopify is exactly this: the only platform you need to build   your empire
column33: reads aletterfrom Lutke on Shopify's investor-relations website. ""Shopify is   the first thing our merchants log into in the morning and the   last thing they log out of in the evening. It's at the heart of   their business -- a responsibility that we take very   seriously.""Moreover
column34: Shopify has only just begun to fulfill its massive   growth potential. The number of businesses using its platform is   still just a tiny fraction of the 10 million merchants with fewer   than 500 employees in its key markets
column35: as estimated by consulting   firm AMI Partners
column36: and the 46 million such merchants worldwide.   With so much growth still to come
column37: Shopify appears poised to   deliver strong gains to investors in the years ahead.Find out why Amazon.comis one of the 10 best stocks to buy nowMotley Fool co-founders Tom and David Gardner have spent more   than a decade beating the market. (In fact

column1: Why Amazon’s Move Toward Autonomous Vehicles Could Be Key to Its Bottom Line;2/1/2017;"E-commerce giantAmazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN) was recently granted a patent that signals its   potential move into self-driving vehicles. The patent indicates   that Amazon is trying to build a technology whereby vehicles can   communicate with each other while approaching a road with a   reversible lane.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();The abstract of the patent says:A roadway management system can generate lane configurations     for a roadway or a portion of the roadway. The roadway     management system can determine the direction of travel for     lanes in a roadway and direct autonomous automobiles to enter     the roadway in a particular lane.This patent is an indication that the company could be working   on autonomous vehicle technology. Something that lends support to   this idea is that Amazon's technical advisor for Prime Air -- Jim   Curlander -- is one of the inventors of the roadway management   patent.Curlander is currently working on developing the technology to   deliver Amazon orders via drones in 30 minutes or less. This   means that he is already involved in the process of automating   deliveries
column2: and autonomous trucks are the next logical step.What does the patent mean for Amazon?With Amazon's technology
column3: autonomous vehicles will be able to   safely plan their routes and better navigate the correct lane on   a reversible road in advance. The patent also points toward the   development of a roadway management system wherein vehicles can   communicate with each other and coordinate their movements.These developments could have widespread ramifications for the   company in two ways. First
column4: Amazon will be able to reduce its   shipping expenses as delivery trucks will spend less time in   traffic after calculating the best route in advance. This will   lead to lower fuel costs and faster transit times. Second
column5: as   Amazon is going to both own and operate this technology
column6: the   company can license it to other automakers for a fee.The first point
column7: however
column8: is currently of greater importance   for Amazon since it would allow the company to bring down   ballooning shipping costs.Delivery costs going through the roofAmazon's outbound shipping costs have grown quickly in recent   years
column9: far outpacinggrowth in the company's shipping revenue.Data source: Statista. Chart by author.These shipping costs will rise once again for 2016. Worldwide   shipping costs in the first nine months of 2016 increased 40%   from the prior-year period to $10.5 billion. Amazon was expected   to add at least another $3.9 billion in shipping costs during the   fourth quarter
column10: giving us a total spend for 2016 of $14.4   billion.The company's unwavering focus on reducing shipping times for   customers -- especially Prime members -- is largely responsible.   Costs could rise further in the future as the company rolls out   its one-to-two hour deliveries to more locations. As a   result
column11: Amazon is working toward the development of autonomous   delivery technology like drones and self-driving trucks to reduce   both personnel and fuel costs.Why self-driving trucks are a natural progression for     AmazonAmazon has not provided specific details for how it plans to   use the patent yet
column12: but recent developments point toward the   eventual reality that Amazon will roll out self-driving trucks at   some point in the future.In Dec. 2015
column13: Amazon purchased ""thousands"" of truck trailers   in order to move goods between warehouses. Then
column14: in Jan. 2016
column15: the company acquired a 100% stake in package delivery company   Colis Privé in order to expand its last-mile delivery   capabilities. It appears Amazon is gradually building a delivery   system that it personally owns
column16: so it may have greater control   over the movement of goods.And according to Business Insider
column17: Amazon is also expected to   launch an app this summer that will match truckers with shippers
column18: creating an Uber-like marketplace for transportation and   delivery. This move will allow Amazon to eliminate a 15%   brokerage fee that needs to be paid to the middlemen as it can   get in touch directly with trucking companies. The app can also   improve the efficiency of transportation as it is expected to   provide driving directions and truck stop recommendations by   planning the route and estimated time in advance.These moves seem to complement the broad strategy of exerting   more control over the supply infrastructure as Amazon reduces   costs wherever possible
column19: boosting profitability and expediting   the delivery process at the same time.Find out why Amazon.comis one of the 10 best stocks to buy nowMotley Fool co-founders Tom and David Gardner have spent     more than a decade beating the market. (In fact
column20: the newsletter     they run

column1: Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Cracks All-Time Highs With a Big Q4 Beat;2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) piled on to its outstanding 2017 after Wednesday's bell
column3: putting out a Street-beating fourth-quarter earnings report that has FB stock primed to set new all-time highs.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFacebook stock was up 2% in Wednesday's after-market trading
column4: adding onto 16% year-to-date gains to make it one of the best-performing blue chips on the market. You can thank FB's unrelenting operational growth
column5: which took center stage Wednesday afternoon.For its Q4
column6: Facebook posted a sizzling 53% surge in revenues to $8.83 billion
column7: and earnings that came to $1.41 per share. Wall Street was looking for sales of $8.52 billion and profits of $1.31 per share.That marked the seventh straight beat for Facebook
column8: which had plenty of highlights in its Q4 report:Daily active users (DAUs) jumped 18% to 1.23 billion.Mobile DAUs rose 23% to 1.15 billion.Mobile advertising revenue came to 84% of all advertising revenue
column9: up from 80% in the same period a year ago.The cash balance is now at $29.45 billion.Some investors were wary heading into Wednesday's announcement following a Q3 report that also saw top- and bottom-line beats
column10: butdisappointed on the guidance front. That sent FB stock to one of its biggest dips since the company's 2012 initial public offering.5 Stocks to Buy to Defy a Weak FebruaryShould the after-market gains hold
column11: Facebook shares will be in brand-new territory.FB shares currently sit above all their important moving averages
column12: and the break above all-time highs would take out the last remaining bit of price resistance.Also important to note is Facebook's 2%-plus run in Wednesday's regular trading hours
column13: during which FB stock scrawled out a golden cross - a bullish technical indicator that occurs when the 50-day moving average crosses above the 200-day MA.But as for the fundamentals
column14: it is important to put the growth into perspective. Consider thatAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column15: NASDAQ:GOOGL) is only growing its top line at about 20%-plus andTwitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR) is posting increases of only 8%. So FB is really in a league of its own
column16: especially given its massive size.Yet it certainly helps that the company continues to find new users. According toa tweetfrom Bloomberg's Shira Ovide: ""Facebook in a year added 269 million monthly active users. Nearly a whole Twitter's worth of users in one year.""Despite all this
column17: there probably should still be caution with Facebook stock. Keep in mind that management has indicated that the torrid growth rates cannot continue. Although
column18: it is far from certain to what degree. In the prior quarter
column19: the CFO pointed out that there could be""meaningful""drop.OK then
column20: why might there be a slowdown? First of all
column21: it will probably get tougher to find new users. For example
column22: Facebook is banned in China. And rivals in the country
column23: likeWeibo Corp (ADR)(NASDAQ:WB) andTencent Holdings Ltd(OTCMKTS:TCEHY)
column24: have been capitalizing on the opportunity.Besides
column25: the fourth-quarter growth was bolstered with holiday spending - which drives quite a bit of ad spending - as well as the presidential election
column26: which relied heavily on social media. Oh
column27: and then there was the controversy with ""fake news."" FB has already implemented systems to reduce this
column28: which could result in fewer clicks.And finally
column29: Wall Street's reaction to the Q4 results has been fairly muted. Hey
column30: shouldn't there be more of a spike - given the huge growth numbers? Then again
column31: investors have already been factoring in much of the good news - and then some. What's more
column32: with the upcoming Snapchat IPO
column33: the offering may mean that investors will plow some of their winnings from Facebook stock into the new offering.Tom Taulli runs the InvestorPlace blogIPO Playbook. He is also the author ofHigh-Profit IPO Strategies
column34: All About Commodities
column35: andAll About Short Selling. Follow him on Twitter at@ttaulli. As of this writing
column36: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceAdvanced Micro Devices
column37: Inc. (AMD) Stock Won't Stop at $12H1B Visa: 5 Things to Know About Trump's Proposed ReformWhy Amazon.com
column38: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Should Expect Fireworks SoonThe postFacebook Inc (FB) Stock Cracks All-Time Highs With a Big Q4 Beatappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Why Is Wal-Mart Scrapping Its Membership Shipping Program?;2/1/2017;"Wal-Mart (WMT) is now providing free two-day shipping to all its customers on orders of $35 or more instead of charging a membership fee of $49 per year through its existing shipping program
column2: ShippingPass. This comes as one of the first major changes since Wal-Mart purchased Jet.com last year. ((Wal-Mart offers free two-day shipping in latest attempt to compete with Amazon
column3: Reuters
column4: Jan 31 2017)) This appears to be a move to better compete with Amazon's Prime service.The e-commerce market in the U.S. continues to grow at a steady rate
column5: as online orders accounted for 8.4% of total retail sales in Q3 2016
column6: up from 7.4% in the comparable 2015 quarter. As online sales growth continues to outpace the total retail market
column7: retailers need to focus on enhancing their online platforms to meet the increasing demand. With this move

column1: 3 Big Mergers & Acquisitions That We Could See in 2017;2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt looks like 2017 is likely to be a big year for mergers & acquisitions. Several factors have come together over the past few months that have made the coming year ripe for consolidation. Industries like biotechnology and retail were beaten down in 2016
column3: and that has opened the door for a flurry of activity within those sectors.makeArticleAd();Not only that
column4: but the Donald Trump administration could also provide a boost for M&A activity. Trump's ""America first"" focus
column5: as well as his plans to loosen regulations weighing on U.S. corporations
column6: may make it easier for companies to merge.One of President Trump's campaign promises was to reduce the tax burden that U.S. companies face. A lower corporate tax rate means U.S. firms will enjoy an influx of cash
column7: which could in turn give them the means they need to invest in growth via mergers & acquisitions.The Top 10 Dow Dividend Stocks for FebruaryHere's a look at three firms that are likely to see some M&A action in the year ahead.Possible Mergers & Acquisitions: Netflix(NFLX)Source:Vivian D Nguyen via Flickr (Modified)Streaming serviceNetflix Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX) has seen its share price soar over the past two years as the firm expanded its reach across the globe. NFLX has been able to tap into popular culture and create original series that appeal to the masses. The firm has also made its way overseas and proven that online streaming services are gaining traction across the globe.As one of the most popular names in the industry
column8: Netflix's expertise makes it an appealing takeover target for tech firms that need to add streaming to their business model. While companies likeWalt Disney Co(NYSE:DIS) orAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column9: NASDAQ:GOOGL) might be interested in snapping NFLX up
column10: it'sApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) that has the most potential as a buyer.Apple not only has the cash necessary to make such a large acquisition
column11: but the company stands to gain quite a lot by owning NFLX.Netflix has done for movies and TV what Apple did for music back in the early 2000's. However
column12: in recent months AAPL has taken a lot of flak for being unable to innovate. By adding NFLX stock's streaming business to its repertoire
column13: Apple would put itself at the forefront of the entertainment business.Possible Mergers & Acquisitions: Barnes & Nobel (BKS)Source:Mike Kalasnik via Flickr (modified)Brick-and-mortar bookstoreBarnes & Nobel
column14: Inc.(NYSE:BKS) has been struggling under the weight of online retailers
column15: namelyAmazon.com
column16: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)
column17: and now the company's depressed stock price makes it an appealing takeover target.One firm that is likely to be interested in adding BKS to its business is the company that single-handedly pressured the bookstore into this position- Amazon. AMZN has recentlymade a push into having its own physical bookstores
column18: and Barnes and Nobel's locations could be easily converted into Amazon locations with very few expensive upgrades.7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 2018Not only has Barnes & Noble followed in Amazon's footsteps by offering an electronic e-reader
column19: but BKS locations have a designated space in each store where the e-readers are sold. That would make it relatively easy for Amazon to rebrand the stores and sell their own Kindle devices.Possible Mergers & Acquisitions: Acadia Pharmaceuticals (ACAD)Source: ShutterstockThe biotech space is prime takeover territory
column20: as the sector has been beaten down over the past year
column21: making consolidation within the industry much more likely. Investors can expect to see a flurry of M&A activity in this space throughout the coming year as bigger firms look to beef up their drug portfolios by acquiring their smaller
column22: more specialized peers.Acadia Pharmaceuticals Inc(NASDAQ:ACAD) is one such company that is likely to see some takeover action sometime over the course of the year. The company has already been the subject of takeover rumors over the past few months
column23: and 2017 looks like the year it might happen.One of the reasons Acadia looks so enticing to big pharma firms is the company's drug Nuplazid
column24: which has already been approved to treat psychosis experienced by those affected by Parkinson's disease. However
column25: what's more promising is the fact that Nuplazidmay also gain approvalto be used for other mental illnesses
column26: including Alzheimer's disease - which could become a major money maker.It's unclear which firm will strike first
column27: but rumor has it that everyone fromPfizer Inc.(NYSE:PFE) toBiogen Inc(NASDAQ:BIIB) toGilead Sciences
column28: Inc.(NASDAQ:GILD) is interested in buying Acadia.As of this writing
column29: Laura Hoy was long AAPL and NFLX stock.The post3 Big Mergers & Acquisitions That We Could See in 2017appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Will Microsoft's $1 Billion Cybersecurity Play Hurt Smaller Players?;2/1/2017;"Microsoft(NASDAQ: MSFT) recently announced that  it will invest over   $1 billion per year on cybersecurity research and development.   That amount
column2: which is equivalent to roughly 8% of its R&D   spend over the past 12 months
column3: doesn't include any acquisitions   that Microsoft might make. Let's see why Microsoft is beefing up   its cybersecurity efforts
column4: and what that could mean for smaller   players across the fragmented industry.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();What cybersecurity means to MicrosoftMicrosoft's Windows is the most widely used PC operating   system in the world
column5: Office is the  most popular   productivity suite
column6: and Azure is the second largest cloud   platform in the world afterAmazon's(NASDAQ: AMZN) AWS. Much of this massive ecosystem has   traditionally been protected by third party companies.   Microsoft's own products -- like Windows Firewall
column7: Windows   Defender
column8: and Microsoft Security Essentials -- were  often   considered inferior to third-party ones.However
column9: Microsoft's ecosystem has become more cohesive under   CEO Satya Nadella's ""One Windows"" strategy
column10: which aims to install   the same OS and app store across multiple platforms. Since users   would ideally download apps from the Windows Store and deliver   their data to Cortana and Bing via Azure
column11: it would be logical to   add first-party
column12: self-updating security solutions across the   entire ecosystem. Microsoft claims that the number of weekly   cyber attacks has risen from 20
column13: 000 to as many as 700
column14: 000 over   the past two to three years.To counter those threats while expanding its ecosystem
column15: Microsoft acquired three Israeli cybersecurity firms over the   past two years -- enterprise security start-up Aorato
column16: cloud   security firm Adallom
column17: and data protection firmSecure Islands. Those acquisitions and its planned R&D investments could   help Azure challenge AWS
column18: which already integrates an    arsenal of security features into its cloud infrastructure   platform. Azure's revenue surged 93% annually last quarter
column19: but   Microsoft hasn't revealed its exact sales figures yet.How this could hurt smaller playersAs Microsoft's cybersecurity ecosystem grows
column20: it could overlap   with the services of many smaller stand-alone third-party   players. For example
column21: Microsoft recently  launched Windows   Defender ATP (Advanced Threat Protection) for Windows 10. That   endpoint service matches events with Microsoft's cloud-based   Security Graph
column22: which gathers data across over a billion Windows   devices worldwide. It also works with Microsoft's email   protection services from Office 365 and Microsoft Advanced Threat   Analytics.This platform directly competes against ""perimeter"" players   like threat prevention firmFireEye(NASDAQ: FEYE) and next-gen firewall vendorPalo Alto Networks(NYSE: PANW) . During last year's RSA Conference
column23: Microsoft   principal research lead Tanmay Ganacharya toldDark Readingthat Windows Defender ATP can ""help capture network traffic out   of a given endpoint""
column24: so that it could ""detect the same attacks""   as FireEye and other threat detection services.Consider what $1 billion means to these smaller cybersecurity   companies. Palo Alto and FireEye are expected to respectively   generate $1.8 billion and $720 million in revenues this year --   so there's no way that they could match Microsoft's R&D   investments. Windows
column25: Office 365
column26: Azure
column27: Dynamics
column28: and other   platforms all give Microsoft the ability to bundle and scale up   its cybersecurity services very quickly. It can also offer lower   prices and offset those losses across other parts of its   ecosystem.But ""best in breed"" cybersecurity firms could still     surviveMicrosoft's growing interest in the cybersecurity market could   render some smaller players obsolete
column29: but ""best in breed"" players   like FireEye and Palo Alto have survived similar assaults from   bundled players before.Cisco(NASDAQ: CSCO)
column30: for example
column31: has aggressively bundled threat   prevention and next-gen firewalls into its networking hardware   and software. Yet FireEye still serves 5
column32: 000 customers across 67   countries
column33: which includes nearly half of the Forbes Global 2000.   Palo Alto serves over 35
column34: 500 customers in more than  140   countries
column35: including 80 of the Fortune 100 and half of the Global   2000.Those numbers indicate that companies will likely value a   company's track record and reputation over the convenience of   cheaper bundles. They also indicate that it could be smarter for   Microsoft to either acquire or partner with smaller stand-alone   players instead of trying to render them obsolete.The key takeawayBeefing up its cybersecurity business will help Microsoft   counter Amazon and tighten up its ""One Windows"" ecosystem. While   some of the new features seem destined to crush third-party   security players
column36: investors should remember that companies will   likely stick with ""best in breed"" players instead of the cheapest   bundle
column37: and a mass switch to a new security platform can be   costly and time consuming.Therefore
column38: investors in cybersecurity companies should be   mindful of Microsoft's ambitions
column39: but they should remember that   many ""best in breed"" companies have weathered similar attacks   from companies like Cisco before.10 stocks we like better than MicrosoftWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column40: it can pay to listen. After all
column41: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column42: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column43: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Microsoft wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4
column44: 2017Teresa Kersten is an employee of LinkedIn and is a member     of The Motley Fool's Board of Directors. LinkedIn is owned by     Microsoft.Leo Sunowns shares of Amazon.com and Cisco Systems. The Motley Fool     owns shares of and recommends Amazon.com and FireEye. The     Motley Fool recommends Cisco Systems and Palo Alto Networks.     The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock: Buy This Old Dog for Its New Tricks;2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsCompanies likeMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) are rare for a reason. You can call it the Polaroid effect: Scientist and inventor Edwin H. Land's idea for a light polarizing lens sparked multiple innovations
column3: includinginstant photography.makeArticleAd();Source:Johannes Marliem Via FlickrTogether with businessman George Wheelwright
column4: Land formed Polaroid in 1937. Land and Wheelwright completely dominated the instant photography sector
column5: until that sector was no longer relevant. Once considered an economic bellwether
column6: Polaroiddeclared bankruptcyin 2001.True

column22: whether live or scripted

column25: on a global basis. This is a dance FB stock shareholders should fear

column1: Will the Apple Inc. HomeKit Beat Amazon’s Alexa? (AAPL);2/1/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) announced HomeKit - its strategy for becoming the center of the smart home - in June 2014.Amazon.com
column3: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) revealed its Alexa-powered Echo smart speaker that November.makeArticleAd();Source: Apple/AmazonWhile there are currently several dozen HomeKit compatible smart home products
column4: Amazon's Alexa is now connected to thousands of smart products and services and has spread from the Echo to third-party devices.On the surface
column5: it looks as though Amazon has outmaneuvered and thoroughly trounced Apple. But despite the seemingly insurmountable lead and momentum
column6: AAPL could still end up beating AMZN in this smart home race.Here's how.Apple Chose the Closed Approach With HomeKitApple tends to be extremely cautious. Its software is designed to be user-friendly and secure. iPhone apps can't just be downloaded from anywhere; they need to go through the official App Store and that requires approval by AAPL. Third-party hardware needs to be certified by Apple before it can be marketed as being iOS-compatible.It's that ""walled"" approach that hasmade the iPhone more securethan smartphones runningAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOGL) Android operating system.With the iPhone and Siri - Apple's voice assistant - at the center of Apple's smart home strategy
column7: that focus on security
column8: compatibility and ease of use carried over toHomeKit. Manufacturers who want to make their smart devices HomeKit-compatible face a daunting series of requirements.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Has a New Hero: Services!As pointed out in a recent Reuters article ondiffering smart home approaches
column9: this includes being forced to buy a special HomeKit chip
column10: being limited to approved (and more expensive than average) Bluetooth and Wi-Fi chips and even extends to manufacturing being limited to factories that are certified by Apple. End-to-end encryption is mandatory. Once a HomeKit product is ready
column11: it faces extensive testing by Apple engineers to ensure compatibility.Thenit may be sold. That process alone can take three to five months.So you have additional costs
column12: the procedural red tape and a delay. It's easy to understand whyApple currently lists only 75 or so HomeKit-compatible devices. And half of those are either different color options or regional variations of the same product.Amazon Alexa Is Open for BusinessAmazon took a radically different approach with its Echo speaker and Alexa. The company openly courted third-party companies to develop Alexa ""skills"" or software-enabled interactions with an Amazon Alexa-powered device.A skill can be the ability to tell Alexa to order anUber. It could also be telling Alexa to turn on your home's smart lights or to start your electric car. The process is simple. Amazon provides an example showinghow to build an Alexa skill in 60 minutes
column13: and that includes the time needed to create a developer account. Submit the skill to AMZN for a quick verification
column14: and it's published.That's how Amazon Alexa tripled its available skills in just three months last year
column15: hitting 3
column16: 000 in September. If that sounds impressive
column17: by CES 2017 in January
column18: it had hit more than 7
column19: 000 Alexa skills.In addition to skills
column20: Amazon also encourages third parties to integrate Alexa functionality into their products. That way
column21: consumers get the Alexa experience without requiring an Echo speaker.That's a far easier process than Apple HomeKit certification. A ""Works with Alexa"" label takes about 10 days to obtain (it can even be issued by third party labs) and doesn't require special chips. According to the Reuters post
column22: that has resulted in over 250 products that are Alexa-certified. We saw some of these at CES
column23: including third-party speakers with Alexa and even home appliances with built-in Alexa capability.Smart Home Security: Apple Strength
column24: Amazon Alexa VulnerabilityThe differing approaches of AMZN and AAPL have led to Alexa rapidly leaping to a massive lead over HomeKit in the smart home. However
column25: there is one scenario where this could change rapidly.Security is increasingly becoming an issue for smart
column26: connected devices. Apple's HomeKit approach emphasizes security
column27: to the point of forcing the use of specialized chips and even certified manufacturing facilities.Amazon's Alexa strategy
column28: on the other hand
column29: leaves its platform relatively exposed. Amazon told Reuters it can't guarantee the security of third-party devices running Alexa. Those thousands of Alexa skills also integrate with third-party services that may have their own vulnerabilities.Trade of the Day: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock No Longer a Home RunAll it would take is one catastrophic hacking for a PR disaster that turns consumers off Alexa. As CNET puts it in a review of thehacking risks for different smart home standards: ""Don't assume that a device has high security standards just because it works with Alexa.""Bottom LineThere's no disputing the fact that Amazon completely caught Apple and others off guard with its stealthy approach of sneaking Alexa into the home using its Echo connected speaker.Before the Echo
column30: it was generally assumed that a smartphone would be the natural smart home controller. Making Alexa integration so open has also paid off for AMZN
column31: resulting in a formidable lead in the smart home in a very short time. That lead may well turn into complete domination of the connected home. But Amazon's open approach may also prove to be its Achilles heel.Should hackers turn their attention to Amazon Alexa
column32: the resulting headlines may flip the equation and put the much more secure Apple HomeKit on top in the long run.As of this writing
column33: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Pops Following Vindicating Q1 EarningsFriday Apple Rumors: Designer Creates Interesting iPhone 8 ConceptCan Apple Inc. (AAPL) Afford a War With Qualcomm
column34: Inc. (QCOM)?The postWill the Apple Inc. HomeKit Beat Amazon's Alexa? (AAPL)appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: What Apple's (AAPL) Earnings Say About The Future;2/1/2017;"When you regularly give your opinion on something as unpredictable as financial markets
column2: gloating when you get something right is rarely a good idea. That is especially true when those opinions arearchivedfor all to see; it's too easy for a reader to check out that archive and find examples of when the market and hindsight combine to make even logical arguments seem foolish. I am fully aware of that
column3: but when it comes to yesterday’searnings release from Apple(AAPL)
column4: I will still say""told you!""What really matters about the Apple release to investors is certainly not that I got it right
column5: nor is it even that the tech giant returned to growth in revenue for the first time in a year
column6: nor that the already great margins at Apple increased. Those last two are important
column7: but necessarily backward looking
column8: as all hard data in an earnings release are by definition.What matters most is what the report tells us about the future and there the message was somewhat mixed.makeArticleAd();The official guidance for Q1 2017 contained in the release fell just short of Wall Street’s expectations
column9: which would normally be enough of a negative to more than offset the good historical results. In this case
column10: though
column11: a look at where Apple succeeded in Q4 2016 suggests that that guidance may just be another example of Apple’s past tendency to err on the side of under-promising and over-delivering when it comes to guidance. That is why
column12: even though growth stalled last year
column13: AAPL has beaten EPS expectations in three of the last four quarters.First and foremost
column14: iPhone sales hit another record. That is particularly significant as not that long ago many were predicting that Google parent Alphabet (GOOG:GOOGL)’s move into the phone business would do Apple some serious harm. It looks now as if those saying that were about as accurate as those that maintained that the Windows phone from Microsoft (MSFT) or the Amazon (AMZN) Fire phone would be the next big thing.The fact is that the iPhone has an iconic status that looks almost impossible to challenge. Even phones that are objectively better in some ways
column15: such as memory capacity
column16: camera resolution
column17: or speaker quality for example
column18: cannot take market share. As Apple advances the iPhone with each release
column19: beating them on those and other fronts becomes harder
column20: but remains
column21: according to the evidence so far
column22: a pointless exercise. As long as that dynamic remains
column23: holding Apple stock and adding to holdings at times of weakness still makes sense for investors.The weakness in this release was mainly in one area; iPad sales declined for the twelfth successive quarter. That
column24: however
column25: was offset to some extent by strong sales of Macs and Apple Watches. For the latter we are reliant on the word of Tim Cook as Apple doesn’t release a breakdown of watch sales
column26: but
column27: as I pointed out in the article referenced above
column28: anybody who tried to buy a Series Two watch as a Christmas gift is probably aware that sales were at least more than Apple expected. None were available in any of the five states where I tried and most stores have just now received inventory.That shortage of watches
column29: combined with Cook’s admission that they seriously underestimated demand for the iPhone 7 Plus
column30: means that the record sales reported yesterday were achieved with a background of supply constraints. Given that and the fact that there was considerable growth in areas such as services and enterprise operations that still have lots of room for Apple to expand
column31: the message underlying yesterday’s earnings is that
column32: despite conventional wisdom
column33: growth can still be achieved."

column6: or switch   completely to Wal-Mart

The executive has a long history as an entrepreneur and came to   his new position when Wal-Mart bought his Jet.com start-up for $3   billion.""I couldn't be more excited. We are moving at the speed of a   start-up
